intro: Cestrum standleyi, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually yellow or orange in color. Cestrum standleyi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
